Description: Sherd of shoulder of micaceous red-brown ware pottery amphora; inscribed. Possible traces of black sealant lining (pine pitch?) on inside of vessel. Brown Nile silt
Curator's comments: Ptolemaic (or possibly early Roman) Egyptian wine amphora sherd. It has been sealed with pitch, suggesting it was from a wine amphora.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 339)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 671, no. 300)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.095)
